numbered_ace_sentences: 2. The graph displays more people who are 15-24 years old than people who are 40+ years old.
3. This difference could indicate that the younger generation is more optimistic than the 40+ generation.
4. This difference could indicate that the younger generation believes that generations are changing.
5. This difference could indicate that the 40+ generation is more stuck in the past than the younger generation.
6. I wonder whether the world is more focused on change than on past revolutions.
7. I wonder how this focus connects to the fact that the group of 15-24 year old people is more populated in rich areas.
8. There is a gap between the age group 25-39 and other age groups.
9. I wonder why there is a gap between the age group 25-39 and other age groups.
10. I wonder whether the age group 25-39 is special.
11. The top 50% of both sides represents how the world is viewed by betterment.
12. The top 50% of both sides represents how the world is viewed by coming generations.
13. Overall, the graph indicates that different age groups are viewed differently.
14. These different views can change the world view of different countries.
15. The 40+ age group is more established than other age groups.
16. The headline is: how different age groups are changing our world ?
